 void close()
          Closes the stream.

          Flushes the buffer to be written out.

          Returns the amount of pending bits currently not written.

          Writes a single bit.

          Writes only as much bits as neccessary to encode the value of the byte

writeBytePartly

void writeBytePartly(byte byteData,
                     int start,
                     int end)
                     throws java.io.IOException
Writes only a part of a given byte.

Parameters:
start - The start of the byte part. start=0 means the high order bit of the byte
end - The end of the byte part. end=7 means the low order bit of the byte
Throws:
java.io.IOException
